text: As there recently were questions here is a list of things needed for 1.0 release of DataFrames.jl: <https://github.com/JuliaData/DataFrames.jl/issues/2640>

elements.text: As there recently were questions here is a list of things needed for 1.0 release of DataFrames.jl:

text: Are you sure we need to tackle all of these before 1.0? :slightly_smiling_face: I'd say that non breaking things can wait (i.e. are only "nice to have").

elements.text: Are you sure we need to tackle all of these before 1.0?
I'd say that non breaking things can wait (i.e. are only "nice to have").

text: I agree. I list all thing we need to make some "conscious decision" on before releasing 1.0 if we want to include them or not and I split them into two groups: things that are more and less important from my subjective perspective.

elements.text: I agree. I list all thing we need to make some "conscious decision" on before releasing 1.0 if we want to include them or not and I split them into two groups: things that are more and less important from my subjective perspective.

text:
I would love to break `unstack` and make an API that is more clearly superior to Stata and dplyr but that would be a big task.

Any re-write would probably be best for an experimental package cause the API would be very hard to agree upon

elements.text: I would love to break
unstack

and make an API that is more clearly superior to Stata and dplyr but that would be a big task.

Any re-write would probably be best for an experimental package cause the API would be very hard to agree upon

text: I agree `stack` and `unstack` need improvements. What we can safely do is adding multi-column operations under the current API. A next step (maybe a good for DataFramesMeta.jl) whould be to define two new functions with a better API, but they could call `stack` and `unstack` under the hood, as both functions are good performance-wise.

text: Hi guys. I have been “off the radar” for a while :sweat_smile: Can you tell me if there’s any API changes leading to 1.0 release that should be reflected in the cheat sheet?

elements.text: Hi guys. I have been “off the radar” for a while
Can you tell me if there’s any API changes leading to 1.0 release that should be reflected in the cheat sheet?

text: For now the only significant new thing is `subset` function. Other changes are bug fixes or internal stuff.
